incidents.name: Connectivity issue - Miro Sign In

incident_updates.body: From 6:22UTC to 7:27UTC, some users were having trouble connecting to our service. The issue has been resolved successfully, and Miro is up and running again. Thank you for bearing with us!

Some users were facing connectivity issues from 6:22UTC to 7:27 UTC.  We have implemented a fix for this issue and are currently monitoring the results. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and we appreciate your patience.

We have identified an issue where users are unable to connect to our service. Our team is actively working to fix the issue. We are doing our best to have this resolved soon. Thank you for your patience!

incidents.name: Application loading issue

incident_updates.body: From 7:00AM to 17:38PM UTC, a small percentage of users in the United States were having trouble loading the application. The issue has been resolved successfully, and Miro is fully up and running again. Thank you for bearing with us!
Some users in the United States are encountering an issue loading boards and are unable to use our product at the moment. We are aware of the problem and urgently working on its investigation.

incidents.name: Connectivity issue with SSO

incident_updates.body: From 15:35 to 18:26UTC, customers with SSO enabled were having trouble connecting to our service. The issue has been resolved successfully, and Miro is up and running again. Thank you for bearing with us!
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Some users are having trouble logging into Miro through SSO since 15:35. We are aware of the issue and are urgently working on its investigation.

incidents.name: Connectivity issue for SSO

incident_updates.body: We have identified an issue where users are unable to connect to our service through SSO. Our team is actively working to fix the issue. We are doing our best to have this resolved soon. Thank you for your patience!

incident_updates.body: From 5:49 to 8:13 UTC, a small percentage of users were facing connectivity issues with SSO and domain control. The issue has been resolved and all connectivity to Miro is up and running again. Thank you for bearing with us!

Some users were facing connectivity issues with SSO and domain control from 5:49 to 16:38 UTC.  We have implemented a fix for this issue and are currently monitoring the results. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and we appreciate your patience.

We have identified the root cause of an ongoing issue where some enterprise users are unable to connect to our service using SSO and Domain control. Our team is actively working to fix the issue. We are doing our best to have this resolved soon. Thank you for your patience!
Some users are having trouble logging into Miro. We are aware of the issue and are urgently working on its investigation.

incident_updates.body: From 17:22 to 02:44 UTC, a small percentage of users were having trouble connecting to our service through SSO. The issue has been resolved successfully, and Miro is up and running again. Thank you for bearing with us!
Some users are having trouble logging into Miro with SSO. We are aware of the issue and are urgently working on its investigation and solution.

incident_updates.body: The incident is now fully resolved. Thanks for bearing with us and apologies for the inconvenience!
The issue has been identified, and the team is working on implementing the fix. We will post the next update when everything works as expected to all Miro users.
We are currently investigating the issue, and will be updating the status page as we make progress with fixing the issue

incident_updates.body: From 14:28 to 15:17 UTC, a small percentage of users in Business and Enterprise plan were having trouble logging in through SSO. The issue has been resolved successfully, and Miro is up and running again. Thank you for bearing with us!

We have identified an issue where users are unable to connect to our service through SSO for newly authenticated sessions. Our team is actively working to fix the issue. We are doing our best to have this resolved soon. Thank you for your patience!

A segment of Miro users are experiencing issues loading Miro boards. Our team is aware and investigating. Please, stay tuned for updates

incident_updates.body: From 5:02 to 6:04 UTC, users were having trouble loading the application and logging into Miro. The issue has been resolved successfully within 1 hour and 2 minutes, and Miro is up and running again. Thank you for bearing with us!

Some users were facing issues loading the application and logging into Miro from 5:02 to 6:04 UTC.  We have implemented a fix for this issue and are currently monitoring the results. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience.

We have identified an issue where some users are unable to load the application and log into Miro. Our team is already investigating the problem and working on a fix that could get things back to normal.
Some users have encountered an issue loading the application and are unable to use our product at the moment. We are aware of the problem and urgently working on its investigation.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been successfully resolved, thanks for your patience, and apologies for the inconvenience from the Miro team!
The root cause has been identified, and we rolled out a fix. Everything should be working as expected, and we are monitoring the situation to ensure the incident is fully resolved.

We are experiencing a temporary service degradation - boards are loading slower than usual or temporarily not loading for some Miro users. The team is investigating. Apologies for the inconvenience, we will be sharing updates as we learn more.

incidents.name: Some Miro users are experiencing issues with loading boards

incident_updates.body: The team identified the root cause, and implemented a fix. The incident is now fully resolved.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incident_updates.body: The incident is now fully resolved.
The team was able to identify the root cause of the issue and rolled out the fix. The board UI should be loading for all users as expected. We are continuing to monitor the situation.
Some users are currently experiencing issues with board UI loading. We are investigating, and will roll out the fix as soon as possible. Sorry for the inconvenience!

incidents.name: Partial Miro website outage

incident_updates.body: We experienced a temporary website service degradation that lasted from 7:34 pm to 8:07 pm UTC. It affected general miro.com availability and those users, who were trying to log in to Miro boards. The Miro application, existing open boards, and active collaborative sessions were not affected.

incidents.name: Miro website is temporarily unavailable

incident_updates.body: The issue is now fully resolved for all users. Thanks for bearing with us!
We are monitoring the situation after implementing the fix to ensure our service is fully operational. Thank you for your patience, and apologies for the inconvenience.
The issue has been identified, and we implemented a fix – everything should currently work as expected for all Miro users.
Our website is temporarily unavailable, and the team is currently investigating. Our apologies for the inconvenience!

incidents.name: Temporary issues with access to teams

incident_updates.body: The incident is resolved.

The issue is now resolved, and we are working on remediation. If you believe you were affected by this incident, please, reach out to Miro customer support team and they will look into it for you. 

We will be sharing the recap on the incident in the following days – please, stay tuned for updates.
A fix has been implemented and we're monitoring the situation to ensure everything is working as expected.

Please, bear with us – we are working on a fix, and will be proactively reaching out to all of the affected customers. Our apologies for the inconvenience

incident_updates.body: Miro boards were loading slower than usual for some users from 14:56 to 15:15 and from 15:50 to 16:31 UTC. The issue was identified and fully resolved, and everything works as expected.

incident_updates.body: All issues are now fully resolved, and Miro works as expected for all users.

incidents.name: Miro is experiencing temporary performance issues

incident_updates.body: The incident is now fully resolved, and everything works as expected. Thank you for your patience!

incidents.name: Some Miro users experiencing issues with loading boards

incident_updates.body: Miro boards were not loading for some users starting 2:35 pm UTC on October 30, 2021. The issue was fully resolved by 3:27 pm.

incidents.name: Temporary network configuration issues

incident_updates.body: We faced network configuration issues between 08:03 and 08:06 UTC & 08:31 and 08:32 UTC. The issues are now fully resolved, and everything works as expected.

incidents.name: Some Miro users are experiencing issues with loading boards

incident_updates.body:
Miro website and boards were unavailable or loading slower than usual from 13:22 to 14:30 UTC on October 25, 2021.

The event was detected by Miro observability system at 13:22 UTC, and after conducting a thorough investigation, the incident response team identified the issue that caused temporary service degradation and started fixing it.

The issue was triggered by an increase in incoming traffic to Miro website from IP addresses that were identified and immediately blocked by the incident response team.

The fix was implemented at 14:18 UTC, and the affected users started regaining access to the dashboard and boards. The issue was marked as fully resolved for all users by 14:30 UTC.

The incident response team already conducted the retrospective and identified the improvements that need to be made to Miro infrastructure to prevent such issues from happening in the future.
This incident has been fully resolved, and Miro is fully operational. Thanks for bearing with us and our apologies for the inconvenience.
The fix has been implemented, and Miro should now be available to all users. We are monitoring the situation to ensure everything works as expected.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Some users have encountered an issue loading their boards and are unable to use our product at the moment. We are aware of the problem and urgently working on its investigation.

incidents.name: Some Miro users are experiencing issues with creating and editing board objects

incident_updates.body: The root cause has been identified and we rolled out the fix. We are continuing to monitor the situation to ensure everything is worked as expected for all Miro users. Thank you for your patience, and apologies from the team for the inconvenience!

Some Miro users are reporting they are not able to create and edit board objects inside frames. The Miro team is currently looking into this issues, and we will update you once the root cause is identified and the fix is implemented.

incidents.name: Some Miro users experiencing longer board loading times than usual

incident_updates.body: The issue is now fully resolved, thank you for bearing with us!
The fix was implemented and we are now monitoring the situation to ensure that everything works as expected for all Miro users.
Some Miro users may be experiencing longer board loading times than usual – the team is investigating the issue, and we will get back to you with an update when we know more.

incidents.name: Some users experiencing issues with loading newly created boards

incident_updates.body: The issue was identified and we rolled out a fix that resolved the problem for all of the affected users.
Some Miro users are experiencing issues with loading newly created boards. The engineering team is looking into the issue, and we will be updating you as we learn more.

incidents.name: Some users temporarily experiencing slower website loading times than usual

incident_updates.body: Starting 7:32 UTC some users were experiencing slower than usual loading times for Miro homepage and login page. The issues were fully resolved by 8:20 UTC. Our apologies for the inconvenience!

incidents.name: Unusually high load on one of the databases

incident_updates.body:
We were experiencing unusually high load on one of our databases between 03:03 and 03:20 UTC, and some users may have experienced issues with Miro performance. 

The incident team responded to the alert and rolled back the release that caused this issue. Now everything works as expected, and we are continuing to monitor the load on our databases. We do not expect this issue to affect any of our users at this time.

incidents.name: Integration with Google Drive temporarily unavailable

incident_updates.body:
From 9:04 to 15:07 UTC on August 2, 2021 Miro customers were experiencing issues when trying to access Miro integration with Google Drive. Some users also reported temporarily loosing access to other integrations such as Jira Cards.

Out integrations team looked into this and found that the issue happened due to a recent change which led to temporary deletion of app keys. We also discovered that some customers may have experienced issues with accessing the integration with Google Drive starting from Friday, July 30.

At 13:23 UTC on August 2 we deployed a fix to restore the app keys, and Google Drive integration became available to all Miro users by 15:07 UTC. We also confirmed that all other integrations were working as expected.

Thanks for bearing with us and apologies from our team for the inconvenience caused!
The incident is now fully resolved, and all users can access Miro integration with Google Drive. Please, stay tuned for an incident recap, and thanks for bearing with us!
We're now monitoring the situation as Google Drive integration is coming back to Miro users. Please, stay tuned for updates from our team, and apologies for any inconvenience this may have caused!
The issue has been identified, and the team is rolling out a fix. We will let you know once the issue is fully resolved.
Some users may be experiencing issues with installing and accessing Miro integration with Google Drive. The team is investigating, and we will update you once we have more information.

incidents.name: Issues with loading the dashboard and boards

incident_updates.body:
Miro dashboard and boards were unavailable from 06:44 to 08:19 UTC on July 29, 2021.

The event was detected by the incident response team at 06:46 UTC, and after conducting a thorough investigation they identified the issue that caused temporary service degradation and started fixing it.  
  
The issue caused an increase in the latency of board and API requests to our database. This led to temporary performance degradation and made Miro dashboard and boards unavailable for users.

The fix was implemented at 07:51 UTC, and the affected users started regaining access to the dashboard and boards. The issue was fully resolved for all users by 08:19 UTC.

The incident response team already conducted the retrospective and identified the steps they will take to help identify such issues before they start negatively affecting the performance of our product in the future.

The incident has been fully resolved, and everything is working as expected now. We will be sharing the recap of today's issue here, and again want to apologise to all of the affected users for the inconvenience.
The dashboard and boards are now loading, and we expect everything to work as expected. We are monitoring the situation, and will update the status page once the issues are fully resolved.
Some users may still be experiencing issues with accessing the dashboard and / or loading boards. We are working on fixing the issue for everyone. Apologies from the Miro team for the inconvenience!
The incident team identified the root cause and implemented a fix.
The incident response team is continuing their investigation. We will update you when the fix is deployed and all systems are operational again.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Some Miro users are experiencing issues with loading the dashboard and boards. We are aware of this, and are investigating. Please, bear with us, and apologies for the inconvenience.

incidents.name: Some users are experiencing temporary issues

incident_updates.body:
Some users were experiencing degraded performance of Miro app and / or had issues with loading their boards from 05:47 to 06:01 UTC. The incident response team identified the issue and deployed a fix at 06:00 UTC.

Miro app is now fully operational, and we don't expect any further performance issues. Thank you for your patience and our sincere apologies for the inconvenience!
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Some users are experiencing temporary issues with loading their boards and/or minor performance degradation. We identified the problem and deployed the fix, and are now monitoring the situation. Thank you for your patience!

incidents.name: Miro website is temporarily unavailable to some users

incident_updates.body: Miro website was temporarily unavailable from 13:11 to 13:31 UTC due to issues with Content Delivery API on the side of the third-party content platform. The incident response team identified the root cause of the issue and deployed a fix at 13:30 UTC and the website is now fully operational. Thank you for your patience, and our apologies for the inconvenience.
We are monitoring the situation to ensure everything continues working as expected.
We deployed a fix and Miro website is fully operational again. We will be monitoring the situation to ensure everything continues working as expected.
The issue is identified and we're deploying a fix. Sorry for the inconvenience.
We are currently investigating the issue with Miro website and will post more details as we learn more.

incidents.name: The website is temporarily unavailable for some users

incident_updates.body:
Miro website was temporarily unavailable from 09:52 to 10:26 UTC due to issues our third-party CDN provider was experiencing. The incident response team identified the root cause of the issue and deployed a fix at 10:25 UTC.

Now Miro website is working as expected. Thank you for your patience!
The incident response team deployed a fix and Miro website is working as expected. We're on standby and monitoring the situation to ensure the issue is fully resolved.
The incident response team identified the issue – please, stay tuned for updates, we will share them once we have more information.
Miro website (including login & sign-up) is temporarily unavailable for some Miro users. We're looking into the issue and will update the status page when we have more details.

incident_updates.body: All issues with loading resources to Miro boards are successfully resolved. We are sorry for the inconvenience.

Some users were experiencing issues with loading resources (such as uploaded images) on Miro boards from 14:21 to 14:33 UTC. The issue was identified and fixed, and we are currently monitoring the situation.

incident_updates.body: From 05:00 to 5:58 UTC some Miro users experienced longer board loading times than usual. The issue was successfully resolved, and all Miro boards are currently loading as expected. Thank you for your patience and our apologies for the inconvenience!

Some customers may be experiencing a slower loading time of Miro boards than usual. The root cause of the issue was identified, and we already implemented a fix. We are very sorry for the inconvenience.

incident_updates.body: From 07:38 to 08:10 UTC, a small percentage of users were having trouble loading Miro website and in-product dashboard. The issue has been resolved successfully within thirty-two (32) minutes, and Miro is up and running again. Thank you for bearing with us!

Some users were facing issues loading Miro website and in-product dashboard from 07:38 to 08:10 UTC. We have implemented a fix for this issue and are currently monitoring the results. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience.

incidents.name: Performance issue

incident_updates.body:
On March 4, 2021 from 7:30 a.m. UTC some users were experiencing performance issues with Miro website and in-product dashboard.
The incident team identified the issue and successfully resolved it by rolling back the API and board servers. Miro website and dashboard performance were fully restored by 9:12 a.m. UTC. Thank you for bearing with us!

Some users were facing performance issues from 7:30 to 9:12 UTC. We have implemented a fix for this issue and are currently monitoring the results. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and we appreciate your patience.
We have identified the root cause of the performance issue. Our team is actively working on a fix. We are doing our best to have this resolved soon. Thank you for your patience!
